title: Package Custom Metadata Types Unit | Salesforce Trailhead

questions.title: 1What path(s) do you follow to add a custom metadata type to a package?

answers.content: A Setup > Packages > Create New Package > Add Components > Select the name of your custom metadata type and add it to your package
B Setup > Packages > Create New package > Add components > Select Custom Metadata Type > Select the name of your custom metadata type and add it to your package
C Setup > Custom Metadata Types > Click the Package link next to the type you want to package

correctAnswer.content: B Setup > Packages > Create New package > Add components > Select Custom Metadata Type > Select the name of your custom metadata type and add it to your package

questions.title: 2When can you add custom metadata type records to a package?

answers.content: C Either when you create the package or after you create it.

wrongAnswers.content: A Only when you first create the package.
B Only after you create the package.
D You can’t add records to a package.

correctAnswer.content: C Either when you create the package or after you create it.

answers.content: B Go to the custom metadata type’s detail page and click the upload button.
C Go to the package’s detail page and click the upload button.

wrongAnswers.content: D Go to the custom metadata type list and and click the upload link next to the one you want to upload.
A Go to the Installed Packages page and click the upload button.

correctAnswer.content: C Go to the package’s detail page and click the upload button.

questions.title: 4 How do you test to ensure that your package of custom metadata types and records can be successfully installed in a test subscriber org?

answers.content: C You can’t test your installation.

D Use the link in the confirmation email to install the package in a test subscriber org. In that org, click the Manage Records link on the custom metadata type list and check that the records are listed correctly.

wrongAnswers.content: A Use the link in the confirmation email to install the package in a test subscriber org. The custom metadata type is installed as a custom object and appears in that section of Setup.

B Use the link in the confirmation email to install the package in a test subscriber org. The custom metadata type is installed as a new custom metadata type in the subscriber org, but the records are available only if the fields are upgradeable.

correctAnswer.content: D Use the link in the confirmation email to install the package in a test subscriber org. In that org, click the Manage Records link on the custom metadata type list and check that the records are listed correctly.

questions.title: 5What do you need to keep in mind when upgrading your package?

answers.content: D If your package is managed and your field is upgradable, the subscriber org can’t change that field’s values, and the records are overwritten when the package is upgraded.

wrongAnswers.content: A If your package is unmanaged, you can’t update the custom metadata type records.
C If your package is unmanaged, the custom metadata type records can be overridden by your upgraded package data.
B If your package is managed and your field is set to be editable by subscribers, you can still overwrite the record values.

correctAnswer.content: D If your package is managed and your field is upgradable, the subscriber org can’t change that field’s values, and the records are overwritten when the package is upgraded.
